descriptions.description: A more diverse contributor base attracts new participants by creating a more inclusive and welcoming project environment.
As contributors gain skills, they move out of the 'New Contributors' stock and into more experienced roles.
Developer turnover directly reduces the number of core developers as individuals leave the project.
The promotion rate increases the core developer stock by moving experienced contributors into core roles.
The promotion rate decreases the experienced contributors stock as individuals are moved into the core developer role.
The skill-up flow increases the experienced contributors stock by moving new contributors into more experienced roles.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill development by providing direct guidance and tacit knowledge to new contributors.
Comprehensive documentation facilitates skill acquisition by providing accessible, self-paced learning resources.
Effective mentorship increases the promotion rate by preparing experienced contributors for the responsibilities of a core role.
More core developers increase the project's capacity for mentorship, thereby enhancing implicit knowledge transfer.
